text: Conklin-Montgomery House is a historic home located at Cambridge City, Wayne County, Indiana. It was built between about 1836 and 1838, and is a two-story, five bay, brick hip and end gable roofed townhouse. It features a two-story, in antis, recessed portico with a second story balcony supported by Ionic order and Doric order columns. Also on the property is a contributing pre- American Civil War gazebo. Note: This includes and Accompanying photographs It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1975. It is located in the Cambridge City Historic District. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Historic American Buildings Survey in Indiana Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Houses completed in 1838 Category:Buildings and structures in Wayne County, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wayne County, Indiana Category:Historic district contributing properties in Indiana
title: Conklin-Montgomery House
